website_summaries.verdict: Budget option with basic features. Good for people who are new to wireless smart devices that control basic home features.
pros: Looks just like a regular thermostat with the added benefit of constant wireless connectivity
cons: Too basic for people looking to upgrade their climate control system

website_summaries.verdict: The Sensi is a solid option if you're looking for a smart thermostat upgrade that still manages to keep things simple.
pros: Emerson's $130 Sensi Wi-Fi Programmable Thermostat costs less than many other smart-home models, its button interface and app are thoughtfully arranged and it works with Amazon's Alexa
cons: The Sensi doesn't come with algorithmic learning, remote sensors or geofencing capabilities
the thermostat hardware is on the plain side of the spectrum

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this thermostat unless you like manually rebooting electronics
customer_reviews.text: Will not reconnect to the router even if just a brief power loss. Battery backup does not save pin or passwords, has to be manually reconnected every time. If you aren’t home you can’t do anything, just get an error message until you go home and reboot it. Will be replacing it with some other manufacturer’s device that does what even the most inexpensive internet device does and reconnects automatically
customer_reviews.author: Mike. S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great... at first
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat worked for the first few months. Now, the batteries drain quickly and it’s rarely “online”. This means anytime you want to control it on your phone, you can’t. This is the reason we purchased it and it’s disappointing to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these thermostats and used batteries to power them for 1 year and it worked great. This year the thermostats would not stay online. I emailed support and they told me i needed a “c” wire. I explained that it worked for one year on batteries and they never answered back. I installed a new relay switch on my boiler and added a “c” wire to all thermostats. And guess what ? They still drop offline. I emailed support and once again got no answer . Stay away !
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Worthless as a 'smart' device. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I should've believed what the others said. Works great for a couple weeks and then... 'Offline'. I have a number of smart devices and they go offline occasionally, but this device NEVER gets itself back online. I pulled the batteries to reset it and it worked again for a day or two... then offline again. It's useless for wireless. Thermostat? Great. Programmable? Yea it does that. Wireless connectivity? NOPE. If you don't want wireless... buy something else that's cheaper. If you do want wireless.. buy something else that works. Basically.. buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: MSG

customer_reviews.title: No instructions or manual.  Poor Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Installation through Sensi ap is excellent. No instructions on how to program and use thermostat came with product. Nothing included to connect with Alexa. Phone support hold time was over 25 min. Support stated we do not support Alexa product., and laughed. They did send me helpful information but only after I spent a couple hours on line and trying to set up. Instruction manuals need to be included, without them this product is useless. We are connected, but a huge frustration even though we are technically educated. Requested a password change twice and still have not gotten it. Forget this device,
customer_reviews.author: Satviolet

customer_reviews.title: Great item, works perfect with Alexa, simple to install, tech support super, excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the install instructions but it did not work, called tech support and they walked me through the repair immediately and with no problems. It works perfectly and I love being in my bed and just saying "Alexa, what's the temperature inside the house?" *81 degrees* "What's the thermostat set to?" *The AC is set to 82 degrees* "Alexa, lower the temperature by 2 degrees *Air Conditioner set to 80 degrees". The only thing is I wish there was a way for it to be set for, say, 70 degrees and if it's hotter than that, turn on AC, and if colder, turn on heat. AC or heat still has to be set manually.
customer_reviews.author: Jack T. Amore

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable connectivity issues, broken app, sloppy website. Can't recommend at all.
customer_reviews.text: This is turning out to have been a very poor purchase. The thermostat worked well enough for a short time, however like many others report below, it's started having issues with connectivity with their servers. (What's the point of a remote thermostat if you have to go home to reset it?) Now the app appears to be broken (links to support on the app get "server cannot be found") and their website appears to be having issues too. (Dead links, no server status). Of course they have a very short return window - but the money I'm losing from this POS makes trying another brand an easy decision.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great thermostat, but spotty Wi-Fi connection
customer_reviews.text: Love the ability to control the temperature with Alexa or my phone -- when it works. I don't know if it's a quality control issue or what, but I wish I had listened to some of the previous reviews complaining about Wi-Fi connection issues. And no, it's not a signal or range issue -- my router is only about ~15 feet away, and I have a dozen other devices on my network that are absolutely rock solid. Usually, it reconnects within a minute or two of disconnecting, but it can be pretty hit or miss. It's a shame, because the temperature scheduling through Sensi's own mobile app is absolutely top notch, for half the price of a Nest.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Faulty unit for A/C
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and installed this unit in December 2019. Worked fine for the heater and the Sensi customer support was great for technical wiring questions and issues. When I attempted to use the A/C NIF April 2020, the outside blower would turn on but not pump cold air into the houseZ Sensi support said the thermostat was wired properly and to call out an HVAC specialist. Turns out the thermostat is faulty and according to my tech he has seen several units with the same issue. I am totally bummed but am outside of the return or exchange window. My techs advice and mine as well is to spend a little extra on a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: renee baylard

customer_reviews.title: Great for avoiding c wire
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you are trying to avoid a C wire. There are really not many other options for a smart thermostat without a C wire and who want AC in addition to heat. The app works well and lets you set up schedules. It works for AC for those of you wondering. Even Alexa works well. I would give an extra star for a beautiful interface with local weather, even if it came with a wall plug. This runs on batteries and is black and white... but still amazing for avoiding both a C wire and avoiding an invasive converter (to avoid c wire) that would plug into the furnace/ac unit. This is great for renters.
customer_reviews.author: That other guy

customer_reviews.title: Frequently offline and eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: The thermostat frequently loses wifi connection. Reconnection is sometimes a pain, often requiring battery removal to reboot. It also goes through batteries quickly. And, removing the cover to access batteries can be a challenge. Bottom line - it works fine as a regular thermostat, but the "smart" functionality is very unreliable. Might as well buy a cheaper thermostat with no wifi.
customer_reviews.author: R Keeling

customer_reviews.title: Terrible interface, unable to set alerts. Rubbish!!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, purchased 4 of these for my properties and sending them all back. Very poorly executed. My biggest issue is that you cannot set temperature alerts, and they will not alert you when the power/internet is down. Absolutely rubbish interface. Spending a few hundred more and going Honeywell. The first red flag was that it takes 2 as batteries. Who wants to bother changing batteries? What use is that when the power is down anyway? A proper design would be to have an internal lithium rechargable battery. For sure you'll forget to change these and and up with a damages unit from leaking batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S. Waldman

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Works in the summer time but not the winter. I live in Indiana and the temperature outside can change drastically and when it came time to turn the heat on for the year, this thermostat would not force heat through. It stayed in the 60s even if I had it set on 82. I took it off and put my old Honeywell one back on and my heat immediately began blowing through the house. And it’s not my furnace because it’s less than 6 years old and I change the filters religiously.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one is great!
customer_reviews.text: first one was funky "great support" (english speaking and understandable) 10 minute with agent and decided 1st unit was defective. clicked return and got same model next day. with a little coddling works flawlessly and thr app is great. PLEAE<READ> note that this was purchased through amazon warehouse so it was previously installed by someone else. if you olrder through warehouse be prepard to have "ownership transferred" if previous installer had registered. whole procees took maybe 15 minutes with support. $70 is better than $150 so i can't complain. Love the geofencing (beta") option in app. also has email notifications if A/C acts up
customer_reviews.author: fxsales

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you have an Android phone...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this wifi thermostat to replace a non-wifi Honeywell thermostat. Followed the directions, got to the part where it will connect my thermostat to my wifi through the cellphone app. It refuses. I call tech support. "Is this an Android phone? Oh, you will have problems..." No thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice thermostat!
customer_reviews.text: We can now control the temperature inside our home using our smart phones. So, when we are on vacation, we can check to see if the furnace is working. The thermostat is connected to our Wifi and I had a bit of a problem establishing the connection. I called the help number, had almost immediate contact, and the individual helping me was knowledgeable and patient. I did install the thermostat myself and took a picture of the current status before removal to understand the color of each wire attached to a letter. I also tested the thermostat connectivity to our WiFi after turning it off to make sure the thermostat would automatically connect. It did!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Sensi ST55 Thermostat is a stellar choice!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Emerson Sensi Wi-Fi Smart Thermostat for Smart Home, DIY, Works With Alexa, Energy Star Certified, ST55 and am beyond impressed. As a single woman, this was my first thermostat to install so I was a bit intimated. The product was packed clean and simply, the box contained everything I needed. The instructions were very clear. I did call support and they were gracious, patient and kind. Installation was simple and fairly quick. It operates like a dream! Being able to use Alexa via voice or my app is phenomenal. I can't imagine a better thermostat choice. I did also use the Emerson F61-2663 Wall Plate for Sensi Wi-Fi Programmable Thermostat, White for a super clean look.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spruill

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for seniors!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a Wi-Fi enabled thermostat for my 86 year old mother so I could manage it remotely if needed. But she thought the first two models I I tried were "too complicated" even though one had a large touch screen and the other had voice control. But this one she fell in love with because it has actual buttons. So for anyone purchasing a thermostat for an older person, this is definitely the one I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had found this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with the Sensi Wi-Fi Thermostat!! This was a breeze to install and get set up. It couldn't have been easier! The directions were easy to understand. If you can follow directions, you can do this! It's so easy to program and manage. So convenient and helpful to be able to control the thermostat from anywhere! We love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: KC Fan

customer_reviews.title: NONEXISTENT Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I have this thermostat, and it has worked well in the past. Now, I cannot get the wi-fi to connect. I'VE CONTACTED EMERSON ELECTRIC BY PHONE, EMAIL, AND ONLINE HELP FORM REPEATEDLY WITH ABSOLUTELY NO RESPONSE. Sat on hold for 30 minutes on the phone, followed prompts to receive a call-back, and no response. EMERSON: IF YOU CAN'T GET YOUR CUSTOMER SUPPORT ACT TOGETHER, NO ONE SHOULD PURCHASE ANY OF YOUR PRODUCTS!
customer_reviews.author: VineMast

customer_reviews.title: Wires can be a problem!
customer_reviews.text: I have a "standard" heat and ac thermostat, with W, Y, G and R (Connected to RH and RC) in old thermostat. The Sensi phone app you MUST use to install the thermostat (if you want wireless that is) kept rejecting this as an invalid configuration, it wasn't until I lied to it and said I had a "C" wire that I could proceed. Physically hooking up the wires was not straight forward either as the Sensi connections were......not obvious. Once I had it physically connected, the rest of install to hook up wi-fi and Alexa was a breeze. Appears to be working well, will update in a few weeks
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Kretchmer

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up great product
customer_reviews.text: This Thermastat is great. Online installation directions Easy to set up even for this non electrician old lady. No C-wire no problem. I purchased the separate cord attached to terminal and plugged it in the socket. The wire may not be pretty but it works great! I scheduled my furnace to heat the house before I even get out of bed. No more freezing morning bathroom run. I don’t get home from work until 10:00 pm 3 days a week. So scheduled to go on half hour before I get home. Only negative I can say is Alexa can only raise or lower the temperatures can’t turn it on or off. BUT that I can do on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahb

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I love this thermostat. It’s a few steps above a regular programmable thermostat. I set schedules for both heating and cooling, so there are rarely times I need to adjust the thermostat anymore, but if I do want to, it’s as simple as using the app on my phone or using Alexa. Also, even though I’ve never changed out a thermostat in my life, this was easy to do. I replaced a non programmable thermostat with this one after watching a short YouTube video and following the instruction guide that came with the unit. I’d definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maintaining Wi-Fi connectivity
customer_reviews.text: The thermostat is great, except for the fact that it does not maintain a Wi-Fi connection, despite the fact that the wireless access point used is 30 feet from the unit, and when seven other wireless items in the home that rely on a good Wi-Fi signal (Samsung TV, Sonos music system, iPads and iPhones and a desktop computer) all work reliably without loss of connection. It was apparent that Sensi customer support wanted me to first update all of my equipment before even mentioning that the Sensi's firmware might actually be somewhat flawed - perish the thought!!!!
customer_reviews.author: goanywhere

customer_reviews.title: Zero customer service
customer_reviews.text: To begin with, I've installed numerous thermostats and never had one this hard to wire. It's usually very simple. However, on this Emerson it was difficult getting the wires into their slots which resulted in a broken wire which had to be spliced. I then ran into wi-fi connection problems. There are too many system variables for their simplistic app to cover. I called AND emailed customer service. That was eleven days ago. Have never heard from them! I returned the unit. If you anticipate any connection or service problems don't count on their AWOL customer service for help.
customer_reviews.author: Rick A. T.

customer_reviews.title: Does not support dual or variable speed blowers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and does work via wifi and the phone app. BUT...our HVAC unit has a variable speed blower for energy savings, and this thermostat does not support multiple speed blowers. It just blows at the highest speed all the time. I should have called their support prior, but assumed it would work as there is no info on their site that mentions that it does not work with dual or variable speed blowers. I've had it for about 60 days, so now outside of Amazon return window, and Emerson is unwilling to help. They just referred me to their own 30 day return policy. 100 bucks down the drain...
customer_reviews.author: T.E.Foster

customer_reviews.title: How to install without a c-wire.
customer_reviews.text: We got this thermostat to replace an old one running our 1966 boiler heater. We don't have AC or a fan to run. This thermostat requires a c-wire, so we needed at least three wires to the thermostat, but we had only two wires. So we bought a 24 volt transformer. Attached one transformer wire to the "C" terminal on the thermostat, the other to "HC," then plugged the transformer into 110 VAC. Download the Sensi app to a cellphone. After proving your cell can run the thermostat properly, you can set it for voice control with Alexa ... Btw, you need to cut the red wire loop on the back of the thermostat when installing this way.
customer_reviews.author: D.B. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Is excellent and doesn't need the "C" wire
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few weeks and I can't believe I waited this long. I tried to get another thermostat but it needed the "C" wire and I didn't have that (and I rent my apartment so couldn't / wouldn't go to the AC and change it like you could for some of the other thermostats. But it's great I have routines set up so that it changes the temp for me when I leave, when I get home and I can tell it to change the temperature to what I want. Couldn't ask for more really.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable WiFi Connection and Flawed Design
customer_reviews.text: The unit keeps going offline (losing the WiFi connection) when running on battery. The WiFi router is only 15 feet away, so it is not WiFi network issue. Once it lost WiFi connection, one has to reboot the unit (pull out and reinsert the battery) to get it reconnected to the WiFi network. Also, the unit does not have the ability to store the schedule on-board. The programmed schedule is in the Mobile App. So, when the unit goes offline with WiFi enabled, this thermostat turns into like a Non-Programmable thermostat (remaining in the setting when the unit went offline). However, with WiFi disabled, this Thermostat can be used as a 7-day programmable Thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: FMG

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasts
customer_reviews.text: This smart thermostat does exactly what I want it to do; allows me to change temperature using my google home and set routines, view, and change temperature using my smartphone. It has some other features that I havent tried, like geofencing that I may get to eventually. One of the main draws was that it did not need a power wire from the furnace/AC, and was able to use batteries. Some reviews had me believe that the battery would quickly run out, but it's been 6 months and I haven't had to replace them yet. I've already recommended this to others and would do so again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: This product was my first step into the smart home space. As a renter, I was looking for a smart thermostat that I could install and uninstall it easily without having to worry about damaging the property. I'm decent with electronics but have never put in this type of equipment, and with the instructions that were included it took me about 10 minutes to have thermostat installed and functional. the sensei app is easy to use and program, and works wherever you are. overall, very happy with this purchase so far. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MIchael Peterson, author of How and Why to Franchise Your Business

customer_reviews.title: Huge pain to install, smooth sailing after.
customer_reviews.text: It took my husband and I quite a while to assemble. There’s a lot of steps, and requires a lot of figuring out where things go, unattaching, and reattaching. However if you download the app first it does give step by step instructions as well as allows you to label which is which. Totally worth it though because we have been saving a lot of money by setting timed temperature changes: cool at night, kick in in the a.m., and letting it go down while we’re not at home.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Ledwich

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a home!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace our working thermostat. Mainly for the ability to control from my phone. I know it sounds ridiculous, but I am so glad I got it! I have a 2 story home and the thermostat is on the first floor, so many times I've woken up in the middle of the night cause I'm too cold or hot, and to have the ability to adjust the temp right from bed is amazing! I also love the energy tracking and ability of adjusting the schedule from anywhere, right from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This will not work without a c wire. They say it will, they lie
customer_reviews.text: I've installed many thermostats and this particular model set that it could be installed with only the red and white wires of a heat only system. But they failed to tell you that the Wi-Fi option will not work without the c wire. I was very suspicious of this thermostat but was willing to give it a try because of how quick technology advances. But, using the red and white wire only you cannot use the Wi-Fi option you can only use the manual option. They purposely mislead the buyer in the description.
customer_reviews.author: KMR Rambke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and execution - perfect retrofit size.
customer_reviews.text: Installed and running in thirty minutes. Instructions and the app support are exemplary. This is a fabulous value retrofit to the standard ‘old’ home units - the app is clear simple and can be shared across the family. Great to be out in the town and make adjustments as needed. Haven’t used the Alexa link. I cannot recommend this product highly enough. So delighted it worked straight out of the box with intuitive instructions and app support.
customer_reviews.author: DTee

customer_reviews.title: Installed in less than 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I am a 66 year old woman that doesn't know squat about electrical stuff. I didn't like the quotes I was getting for installing a new thermostat and I HAD to get rid of mine that was 30+ year old . So I drank too much coffee and just used the app to walk me through each step. Piece of cake. I am a very happy woman. I will wait until I have had the unit up and running for more than a couple hours before I do an actual review on that.
customer_reviews.author: roni1854

customer_reviews.title: Energy Saver!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE!! We just received our first power bill since the installation and Florida has been having a very hot August. Our actual kilowatt usage dropped by 25%! Our bill was $52 less than the previous month! The ability to better control our home temperature was apparent after the first day using it. The AC runs shorter cycles and keeps the temperature constant. Our previous 'smart' control had a big deviation in temperature before it would come and then would run an extremely long cycle. Integrated with Alexa perfectly and the app is better than the previous brand.
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Better than EcoBee
customer_reviews.text: Ecobee seems to be overly-zealous and wants to control everything such that you can't decide things for yourself. Emerson is your standard thermostat with some cool features and works well with Alexa. I had an Ecobee thermostat for about a year and hated its online app, the smart app itself, the customer service was awful, etc. Emerson seems much better, does the job, is much better priced, and the app is very nice. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: R. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: First, download the Sensi app to phone. They walk you through the installation. Take a picture of the old thermostat wires and use included wire labels just to be sure. Use the phone app to create running schedules. The console is lighted all the time or using the top button. It is very easy to switch modes, operate fan or make temporary temp adjustment, which will hold until the next scheduled event. Also displays relative humidity. I found this much easier to set up and use than the Radio Thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Seen!
customer_reviews.text: I may be jumping the gun here, but having just replaced a Pro-1 smart (not!) wifi thermostat with this one today, which I received yesterday, this thing's a dream! Installing it's a snap, as are most, but setting it up with wifi and Alexa COULDN'T BE any easier! And the step-by-step instructions that are part of installing the phone app are the most thorough and complete I've ever seen...for anything I've ever assembled/installed, period! It's as if the author of the series of how-to books, ...For Dummies, wrote them! So impressed! All that said, if the unit starts giving me problems down the road, I will definitely revisit this review! For now, I couldn't give this a better recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Cannata

customer_reviews.title: easy to install and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: we love it...super easy to install and we have an old house with old thermostat but installing this model was super supe easy and no wiring involved. Also we selected this option because it best emulates the old thermostat so we had no painting or patching and it is easy to use and understand as a standalone on the wall or better yet from you app. But for the people who are uncomfortable using apps, like my motherinlaw, she can use the thermostat as usual.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl S.

customer_reviews.title: Always Offline
customer_reviews.text: The first day or two the thermostat worked out great but after that it spends more time offline then online. It feels like every time I try to adjust the temperature it results in itself going offline and no longer controlling my system. As a result, I have to constantly reset it by taking out the batteries and putting them back in. Note: it is right next to the room with the router in it so I can’t figure out why it keeps going offline.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Love it, with only ONE big annoyance...
customer_reviews.text: I am 100% pleased with so much about this WiFi thermostat. The guided installation was a breeze. The iPhone app is lovely. The addition of a programmable reminder to change the filter, and many other nice touches. But, as so many others have noted, MANY of us wish that the fan could automatically be kept running while the A/C or heater cycles as needed. Yes, we can manually switch the fan to ON, but why make us do that? We already have a multi-point schedule for temperature. So simply add a "Fan On Override" option at each schedule event. That would completely solve everyone's needs, and it would fit right in with the existing UI and operation. /Steve.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful thermostat!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this several months ago to try to help control our electric use over the summer. I was absolutely delighted with the step by step instructions delivered via app on my smart phone (I was initially concerned because there was so little info in the package itself and ambivalent about doing the install without a printed document.) This app delivered instruction was EXCELLENT. I installed it myself in about an hour from opening the package to setting the thermostat programming. Both the app and the thermostat itself have delivered complete satisfaction... helping me check and adjust the house temp from my phone and to create a weekly program to make best use of our electric service.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Mcneal

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Good Product at a good price, we put this in for our upstairs thermostat. The mechanical unit was having issues and the repair guy thought it was the old thermostat. It turned out to be other issues that i need to repair on the mechanical unit but i decided to keep the thermostat for several reasons. 1. the connection to the wifi and the ability to monitor or change it anywhere i am via the phone app. 2. the connection to Alexa is nice. 3. easy operation. I added the Emerson touch screen Sensi for the downstairs unit and love it also. I have a very slow internet connection at the house and these units still function as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Brett G.

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a thermostat which would allow me to schedule the temperature to be changed throughout the day. My son recommended the Sensi with the Echo Dot. Got it and installed it. I've installed quite a few thermostats, but this was the easiest install I have ever done. Not only can I go to the thermostat and adjust the settings, but I can ask Alexa what the temperature and schedule are, but I can tell her to change the temperature or schedule. It also comes with a phone app that allows me to check the temperature and humidity while I'm away from home and make changes. As I travel a lot, I find these features very useful. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice with Sensei
customer_reviews.text: I chose Sensei because of the very good reviews, Apple home compatibility and shape (the old thermostat was also rectangular in shape and left a rectangular stain on the wall). Installation and Apple home kit integration was very easy. Very recommendable!
customer_reviews.author: mat.ski

customer_reviews.title: Finally, I can control my HVAC from any location!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and instructions were great. I was worried about the electrical connection but the instructions have all the steps required and even came with color coded stickers identify the proper wire. Wifi was also easy to set up and no connection problems after 3 months. I highly recommend downloading the Sensi app before installing. The app takes you through the entire installation and WiFi connection process. The pictures help too. The app can control most features you need and works and looks great. Really like this unit and the convenience of controlling the HVAC form any location.
customer_reviews.author: LexRox

customer_reviews.title: How to install with 2 wires
customer_reviews.text: Here is a picture of which cable i have connected and it work. I can use the app from phone and change the temperature. Also when you setting up the app it won’t let you click next if you just select those 2 wire R and W but just select RH /W plus C that’s how i got to hit next even thought i don’t have a C Wire
customer_reviews.author: Wilfred Frias-Coats

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Alexa Dot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to work with Alexa so i could adjust temp without going to the thermostat. It was easy to install, setup was a little harder because i could just tell my phone to switch to the 2.4ghz band of my wifi, as it thinks it's smarter than me and chooses for me.But that's not the thermostats fault. Ended up using my Fire HD tablet which does not use the 5ghz signal and everything went smoothly
customer_reviews.author: Rocky068 (Rochelle)

customer_reviews.title: no way to setup the wifi
customer_reviews.text: got the unit and installed it on the same day. the installer was easy, the instruction helps some but probably needs more details on the wires, for example, the meaning of each wire. after the installation, i started to setup the wifi connection - the sole reason i bought this unit. well, the phone application connected to the unit without issue, but then it tried to send the unit my home wifi information which it failed spectacularly. each time i tried it displayed "unable to provision the unit" so quickly that i can't even type in the password for my wifi. i have tried it for about an hour and finally gave up. returning the unit today.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: c wire required but good unit
customer_reviews.text: i chose this unit because it gave me the impression that a C wire would not be required. It is required. We have a basic AC and oil furnace system and it was dead in the water without a C wire. The box even says it is required. So, false advertising aside, it is a good thermostat. Very easy to connect to wifi and easy to program with plenty of flexibility. The app works well although a bit cumbersome and clumsy. The one shortcoming is that there is no button to illuminate the screen. You can hit the temp adjust buttons but that will disturb the program if within 2 hours of a set point. Needs a dedicated button.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Buyer

customer_reviews.title: It works, easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Put in a new furnace. My old one couldn't use a smart thermostat. I am happy beyond belief. Super easy installation, easy added to my Wifi, no issues whatsoever. The only issue was the temperature wasn't accurate. I'm talking 2 to 3 degrees ... but still. Called Tech and they walked through me through adjust the temp. The thermostat has a built in adjustment to correct this issue. Not to mention the prompt help by tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Has a mind of its own.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed the auto change over feature. While it is kinda cool I can control this by phone remotely, I don't like that I can't set schedules or the auto change over feature from the thermostat itself. Furthermore, if you happen to change between heat, coool, or auto, it will retain the temperature you have selected for a little while then change to some odd temperature by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Redwood Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Solid.  Why pay more?
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Intuitive app. There are better Wi-Fi thermostats on the market but not for the money. Not a ton of frills but it does what u want - control the thermostat from ur phone remotely & install it yourself easily within 20 min, programable. There’s really nothing more to these things. Color touch screen? Monitor individual rooms with censors. Maybe if u have a baby or a pet with a respiratory condition or something bizarre idk but this works for me. It’s not 250 dollars, it’s ur thermostat. Available through Wi-Fi, compatible with pretty much everything. It’s a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday (Amazon Prime 2-day) and just finished installing it and connecting it to wife, Alexa, etc. Took about 30-40 minutes. Simple installation even if you have basic skills. Everything works as stated and I LOVE this thermostat!! It was packaged great and looks great. Yes, you need to download the Sensi app if you want to control it remotely, but who wouldn't want to do that?!?! That's the reason you buy a thermostat like this. Bottom line for me: great price on a quality product. If you're thinking about getting a wifi thermostat, this is a great entry level product.
customer_reviews.author: Zarah

customer_reviews.title: Works as a thermostat, not working with Google Assistant
customer_reviews.text: My whole purpose in purchasing this model of the Emerson Sensi was that it was labelled in several places as working with Google Assistant. Despite multiple attempts to disconnect and reconnect in multiple apps and locations, I have yet to get the dumb thing to work with voice control. Otherwise, it's a fine wi-fi thermostat that can be controlled via a smartphone app, and programmed with lots of schedules. The interface is not the most user-friendly, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Veilance

customer_reviews.title: Drops wifi connectivity...often
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why there are so many highly rated reviews. I have had two Emerson Sensi Wifi thermostats in two houses for approximately 3 to 4 weeks. One was purchased on Amazon and the second thermostat at a large chain home supply store. Over time each unit lost wifi connectivity multiple times. Unless I could not figure out how to bypass/override the wifi connectivity and run it manually, the absence of this feature is a major drawback. No other wifi problems in either house. One thermostat is being returned to Amazon ( they are great with returns) and the second unit to the big box store. I'll keep looking for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wireless thermostat!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these units. One for upstairs and one for downstairs. The install was straight forward. You don't need to hook up the common "c" wire for the thermostats to work. They work fine on two AA batteries. Once your account is created during installation, you can control the thermostats away from home, via your phone's 4G connection, at no additional cost. The internal sensor and algorithm that controls the activation times seem regulate my home's climate better. A reasonable value, and good performance. I haven't used the voice control features yet (e.g. Alexis). I did purchase the wall plates for a cleaner look.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Anyone can install this!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 65 year old Grandmother. I installed this in less than 30 minutes. That being said, I did read the instructions and uploaded the app before installing. If you try to skip steps you may not be as successful. Works perfectly, and as advertised. I could have spent another 120 dollars to have my thermostat “learn” my habits, but that just sounds creepy to me and unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: T Bee

customer_reviews.title: If you are replacing an old thermostat, you'll save money
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old two wire circular thermostat which never maintained our house temperature consistently. With the Sensi, the temperature is now consistently maintained and we are using less oil. Being able to remotely monitor and adjust the temperature is fantastic. You can set lots of schedules. A caveat is that if you have an old two wire boiler system like we do, you have to add either a wire from the boiler to the Sensi or install and connect to the Sensi a 24VAC transformer (what I did). Tech support was initially "nobody home", but when they finally reached out to me, were helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Mikemikemike1st

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Best installation instructions I have seen. No need to pay someone money to install as long as you can use a screwdriver and are able to follow easy to understand instructions that walk you through every aspect of the installation. Since I do not have a C wire I am a little concerned about battery life but the app and wall display clearly displays the battery life. Compared with the difficulty of running a C wire from the furnace or an outlet changing batteries will not be an issue for me. Plus it is so reasonably priced compared with the alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: francis kingzett

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a smart thermostat for awhile but the prices were outrageous. This Emerson was in my budget so I decided to try it. I had a friend who is familiar with thermostats install it for me. Connected right away with my wifi and with Alexa. Programming was easy and being able to adjust the temperature whenever and wherever I want to is terrific! I read some reviews that complained of the wifi connection dropping out. Maybe its because my thermostat is only 6 ft. away from my modem/router, but I have not had an issue with the wifi. One of the best purchases I have made!
customer_reviews.author: smr61754

customer_reviews.title: Connection is not good.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other devices that grab wi-fi easily, this does not -- and the reconnection process is a tedious pain in the butt that you'll be going through any time you have a power interruption or fail to change the battery before it becomes anything less than about 80% charged. Until, that is, you realize it's just not worth it and use it as an old-fashioned thermostat and wonder why you wasted your money. This may work better if you have a C-wire. They should stop claiming it works well if you don't, because that's a lie.
customer_reviews.author: picky

customer_reviews.title: For My 101 yr. Old Mother
customer_reviews.text: Her temperature comfort range seems to have shrunk to about 77*F, so setting a temperature range (75-77 or 76-78) is about the best we can do. I realize there will be days it alternates between heat and A/C but maybe if you're that old, it's ok. I was looking for the auto-changeover feature. It's great that I can change the temp range from my home so nobody has to make a 20-40 minute trip over to her place. Yes, she lives alone!! The app works great. My only complaint would be that you can only use the auto-changeover from the app, and if anybody makes a change directly on the thermostat, it drops out of auto-changeover.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this thermostat. It was easy to install with info included and what I could find online. Programming was intuitive and the unit integrated well with Alexa. I could adjust the temperature remotely...great! But after two weeks, Alexa disconnected. The unit continued with its regular program, but the remote functionality was gone. I figured out that the batteries were too weak to maintain the connection to my home WiFi network. Ok. New batteries. Two weeks of remote access, then again... new batteries were required for remote functionality. No bueno. Now I use the unit as a regular programmable thermostat. You know, like the ones you can buy for a third of this price! Booooo!
customer_reviews.author: Dorsey247

customer_reviews.title: Review: Emerson Sensi Wi-Fi Smart Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Very nice unit. You have to download the smartphone app to get the install instructions. Smartphone step by step instructions made it easy, even the wiring part. They eliminated two jumper wires by having that done internally. Setting up the smartphone/thermostat to the WiFi was easy too. This replaced a complicated digital setup and this new setup works right. Right out of the box. They even put a built in bubble level so mounting the box straight was easy. Size of this unit hid all the older holes in the wall. No touching up the paint.
customer_reviews.author: DEEPNHOCK

customer_reviews.title: RV thermostat 12v DC
customer_reviews.text: I called and asked tech support about thermostat, if it would run a 12 volt DC controlled system. They said no only 24 volt AC system. Thermostat is a switch, controlled by 2-1.5 batteries. It works great for RV trailers. They are losing alot of customers, not knowing about their products.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line, I'd buy it again for my RV installation.
customer_reviews.text: Additional: Purchased a second unit for new house. Both work perfectly. This stat was easy to pair to the network and is functioning as designed. This was an unorthodox installation into an RV which cannot be done without a strong electrical knowledge, as I had to build a relay bank to control the rooftop AC unit and a separate gas furnace below. For a home installation, I could complete this job in under 15 minutes including wifi setup. The only thing I would change is adding support for the IFTTT protocol.
customer_reviews.author: Thorfinn

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my apartment thermostat to this from the old metal coil type. The biggest thing I love about this is that theres no C-wire required like mostly all smart thermostats. Will update for long term use later but for now it’s working great. Instructions given in the app are clear as well making installation simple. Also the baseplate has a level build in as well so that’s a nice addition. I have yet to have any kind of connection issues with it. Overall great buy. Would highly recommend for a basic WiFi thermostat. Alexa integration works great with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Just-Mike92

customer_reviews.title: Works great without a white wire!
customer_reviews.text: Currently, I rent a house in a warm climate (think Hades) and the previous thermostat was a "dumb" on/off one. After checking the available wires, I found that a white wire was not available and as a renter, I sure as anything was not going to add one. After doing hours of research I found this Emerson smart thermostat with WiFi capabilities that don't require a white wire, but only requires batteries. So far, after 2 months, the available batter indicator is still showing full bars, thus rapid replacement is not a concern. I would 100% recommend this thermostat to anyone and everyone.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: If you have any difficulty call Amazon 1st!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this so I could setup a schedule for my A/C. Seemed like it was going to be easy to install; I verified before I bought it to be sure it was compatible. Instructions were clear; but my electrician son nor I couldn’t figure out what was wrong. Thankfully we got an awesome Emerson tech. Davion had me reprogram it 3 times; he agreed that this was an unusual situation. 40+ minutes on the phone. 4+ hours all together before finally cool air.
customer_reviews.author: Pennye

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with two wire furnace
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of research time, and purchased a 24VAC power source but this unit will not reliably work over wifi. It controls the heat great without the extra power, but as I'm using this in a second home, the wifi option was really important. Technical support was not good by any means. After my initial email, I waited over a week before sending a second email then finally got pointed to a possible solution. The solution did not work. If you have an old two wire system, look for another option. If you have a "c" wire, this is a great inexpensive thermostat!
customer_reviews.author: pablo arnoldo

customer_reviews.title: OVERPRICED and constantly drops Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: I gave this headline overpriced because it is constantly disconnecting from the Wi-Fi which makes it a normal thermostat. In order to get it to connect back to the Internet you have to pull the faceplate off, disconnect the batteries in reinstall them and it will connect back to the Internet for no more than 12 hours. I originally bought this for a cool only system " which it will not work for" and then I wanted it for my garage heater which would be nice if it would stay on the Internet however my old cheap thermostat does the same thing without the Wi-Fi feature.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great product - great install instructions through app
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy to install. Download app first. It walks you through the steps. The hardest part for me was the wires insert them closer to the wall side and hold wire while tightening the crew down. I had to redo a few because they were not held even after tightening. Just be patient. The built in water/bubble level was genius. The programming interface works well. Now I do not have to keep changing setting as the sun warms up the sun-facing located thermostat. Perfect purchase for me. Not sure how it resets and relinks to wifi if power goes out though...read a few comments about that.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and works great !
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase you can change temp through your phone as well as check usage which helped me save on bill which was getting higher turned up ac when I m at work then cooled before I get home and it was very easy to install maybe 30 mins easy for anyone
customer_reviews.author: thepuregame24

customer_reviews.title: and I LOVE it. I can lock the screen so that ...
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth on the review of this product. I had a router with xfinity, which I found out is not compatible with this product. I ended up getting a netgear modem/ router, which I was going to do anyway and was still unable to get it to connect to wi-fi. I had to call the customer service line to get it set up. Finally I was able to connect, and I LOVE it. I can lock the screen so that the temperature can only be adjusted through the app......which is perfect for keeping my teenagers from putting the air on 73 during the day and spiking my bill!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: The fuctionality you want at a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: All I really wanted was a thermostat that could change states when I left the apartment, and look non-invasive enough so my landlord wouldn't notice it. This fits the bill and I've been satisfied with it in the month since I've owned it. I looked at other smart thermostats and they seem to be more focused on making a cool-looking gadget than an actual tool. I really don't need an OLED display to save me electricity. Since I live in California the electric company gave me a $50 rebate (PG&E.) By my calculations, this smart thermostat should pay for itself within 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Apotropaic Sphinx

customer_reviews.title: It works! Tried a Momentum first and it didn't.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install. Didn't want the smart home connection and had to call tech support to find out how to bypass. They answered the phone and a human being told me what I needed to know. It works. I can drop the air conditioning temperature when I'm on the way to the office. When I leave, the programming brings the temperature back up to an energy efficient level.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Breaux

customer_reviews.title: Installation is so easy.
customer_reviews.text: Ok...I was dubious. But, it took me about 15 minutes to install. Granted, I have installed many thermostats in the past, and understand the wiring colors. But the instructions via the app are perfectly clear. I think anyone can easily install, just take your time if you haven’t done one before. Note that like me, you may have a breaker(110volt) for the fan and another for the air conditioner (220 volt). Although you only need to turn off the fan to install, I suggest turning off both. The app allows you to change from heat-cool-off, and change temperature. You can also do this also on the wall unit. It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Davis

customer_reviews.title: simple step wise instructions, with easy to use phone app
customer_reviews.text: Could not be simpler, in fact the holes lined up with what was there previously. The old unit had jumpers and no common wire and this unit is exactly what was needed, Jumpers pre-installed, no C wire needed. the app walks you through the process step by step even to confirming your wired selection and connections. Temp can be controlled through the phone app. Even has some extra features such as air circulate and going to a set temp when you are close. Nice unit. installed - on Gas furnace, with AC, no common wire. Even gives hints so as not to drop wire in wall.
customer_reviews.author: Cohiba smoker

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Install was quite simple but had to call support as my system includes a heat pump. This type of system requires a change in setting that were not apparent in the basic information. Once the change was made all worked perfectly The alexa voice also works as it should. I wish the thermostat turned on the A/C once the humidity reached a pre set point however you do get an email alert if the humidity exceeds 70%.. Too bad you can't set it to a lower number or as I mentioned automatically turn on the A/C at that point. Overall it is a recommended buy!
customer_reviews.author: Gordo

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT - Hardly a smart device
customer_reviews.text: The thermostat seems to function OK. However, the Sensi app frequently says no internet connection so it can't control the thermostat even though all my other WiFi devices (security cameras, light switches) are all connected fine. What's worse, the sales description here claimed the thermostat integrates with Alexa. After I followed instructions and installed everything, then Alexa said it cannot connect with Sensi due to "geographic restrictions." When ordering, they know they are delivering to California. And the two American brands can't work together in the biggest market in the US?! That's so absurd. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S King

customer_reviews.title: Costing me hundreds of dollars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thermostat several months ago and haven’t really thought about it so it was working fine. Now, however, the thermostat is using the “Cool” temperature schedule during the WINTER months. Even though the settings for the schedule are set to Manual (to use no schedule). So not only is the thermostat stuck on a schedule that I did not create and do not want, and by every option is turned OFF, it is turning my heat to 80 degrees every day, all day, unless I turn it off. I have emailed their tech support and, NOTHING. No response at all. I guess I’ll be dropping even more money on a Nest.
customer_reviews.author: Brad D. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great Convenience!
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 of these because of how the thermostats are set up in a large building that i maintain- on 2 different floors. The 3 on the 2nd floor work great- almost never any connectivity problems. The 3 on the 1st floor are constantly offline- We have 2 different types of routers on each floor- so that must be the issue. Never the less eventually the thermostats do come online after a little bit of waiting- and everything works out. The convenience is fantastic- and I'm hoping these things help us save some $!!. Damned energy companies!
customer_reviews.author: Index

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermostat!
customer_reviews.text: This has been an awesome product! I love everything about it! I use it at my business and this way no one else can mess with the temperature. I have it set for everyday to go up and down and this will keep things regulated and should save money when a employee forgets to turn the temperature up or down when they leave at night. Note I don’t have to worry. It also is great if you need to change what’s programmed for a day you just go into the app on your phone and fix the temperature to where you’d like it! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The Sensi unit was easy to set up and use. I don't have an Alexa - i control the unit from my phone. The features are great. I have no experience with other WIFI thermostats but one of the reasons that motivated me to buy this unit was it was easy to read screen. I don't have to get my glasses to read the settings on the thermostat and the app on my phone is simple and effective
customer_reviews.author: GWB

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect & installs easy.
customer_reviews.text: Even I installed this using the iPhone instructions. Emerson has covered all the potential challenges that could develop installing this. I love that you can set the fan to circulate air in 5% increments for just about any percentage of the hour. That was an added bonus. Not to mention being able to control the thermostat from anywhere on my iPhone. You can set the display to show or not show the humidity on the wall. All controlled from your iPhone. Never have had a problem with site connection. Now, if I can figure out how to install another thermostat downstairs with a 2 wire system. Guess I'll have to have an electrician run a C Wire.
customer_reviews.author: MGL0120

customer_reviews.title: ... only point at which the installation was not so easy anyone could do it was when it came to ...
customer_reviews.text: A friend installed these for me and the only point at which the installation was not so easy anyone could do it was when it came to the jumpers. Just know that if you have separate wires for HC and HV, this model has a built-in jumper so you literally have to do NOTHING to accommodate that. I absolutely love being able to control the temp from my phone and the backlighting is a nice touch for nighttime adjustments. I haven't set up scheduling yet, nor have I attempted to use Alexa with it but just having the app was enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Julie F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install. WOrks well.
customer_reviews.text: Even easier to connect and change the temp with Alexia, echos, or the Smart Things apps. Looks nice and performs well. It has a large easy to read display. A lot easier to schedule than my last one when using one of the apps. We have rolling brown outs so I've been keen to see if it'll be a pain to reconnect if the wifi drops out, but it picked it right back up, just like everything that works with wifi, takes a sec but you can just manually change anything until then. Happy with it. Now can change the AC from rooms away and track my usage.
customer_reviews.author: Derf 0__o

customer_reviews.title: Simple to set up
customer_reviews.text: I needed a thermostat that had the ability to run a schedule yet allow periodic occupants to be able to adjust the temp within a defined range yet prevent them from exceeding it on either side. After two hours the thermostat resumes my schedule. Gone are the days where some knucklehead set the temp to 70 degrees in the peak of 100 degree summer days then leaving without putting it back to 80 where i want it when the space is empty. This unit has paid for itself during the first month of use. The internet interface is simple to set up and use, the optional web interface is a bargain at $10 a year.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Good smart thermostat for the price you pay
customer_reviews.text: I made two purchases of these smart thermostats three months ago (at different prices) for my two central AC units. I am generally happy with them. Instructions to set up the Sensi thermostat are very clear but WiFi connection is tricky and may need to take several tries. Temperature control is good and I can control the units remotely from my phone. The biggest complaint I have is that these two thermostats will drop off internet connection from time to time, not simultaneously though. They will come back alive maybe 10 - 15 mins later but it's kinda annoying. Neverthelessly, the manual control on the panel still works.
customer_reviews.author: K. C. Lea

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while to do this review because I wanted to give it "burn in" time, make sure it actually stayed connected and worked all the time. Well, it does. It was very easy to install and connected right up to my wifi, no problems at all. I've since used my phone as well as Alexa to adjust the temperature and switch between heating and cooling and it just works. The control even sends me a notification if the AC has been running too long because I left a door open or something. Here in Vegas, that's a good thing! I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TheAlienJr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install,  works great with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and it's working great. I like being able to control the temperature from anywhere and Alexa makes it even more convenient. Forget to change the temperature for bed time but you're already comfy in bed? No problem. Just tell Alexa to do it for you. The scheduling is great, but our schedule is too unpredictable to make it useful. Another feature that worked out great was the temperature offset. It didn't seem to match the old thermostat so I just put batteries back in the old one, left it next to the Sensi to see what the difference was and adjusted accordingly. It was a 3 degree difference so matching the temps was very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: RobertM

customer_reviews.title: Money saving long distance home monitoring with Sensi.
customer_reviews.text: We are Florida snowbirds who spend summers in Wisconsin. We have a Sensi thermostat for both our houses. In winter our furnace has to heat the house in -30 degrees to keep pipes from freezing. In summer our AC has to be able to keep the humidity out of a hot humid southwest Florida house. We are able to see what is happening in an instant at both homes and adjust the temperatures as is necessary. We save money by setting the empty house at a higher or lower temperature than we would have if we were there. Than adjust it to a comfortable temperature just before we arrive when we transition back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: George Davis

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have purchased sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This Sensi Wi-Fi thermostat was super easy to install, and registering was very easy along with instructions. I am amazed how much control you have with setting the heat or cooling, so many times my kids would leave the house and forget to turn off, and would run all day with no one home, now don't have to worry about that, I will definitely save money on that!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Buyer beware though, if the batteries run out energy, it will shut down your heater. I had no clue and called a service repairman because my heater would not come on. Image my embarrassment when the service guy installed 2 AA batteries and voila! it came on. I had no clue such a simple thing controls the whole heating system. I have noticed now that I have to replace the batteries every month. They don't last long. Other thermostats I have had in the past last a whole lot longer. Other than that it works great and was easy to install but I would not buy again because of the battery usage.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Matts

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Had it half a year. Constantly loses wifi, now won't reconnect after following the steps many times. Spend more and get something that works. Update: I absolutely hate this device. All I do is fight with it. Customer service is worthless. App is garbage. Batteries run out after a month of use. Then you spend 45min fighting with it to get it to remember everything.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: EASY to install
customer_reviews.text: After you connect the wires to the unit, all you have to do to get the wireless to work is Install the app first. Then follow directions. Takes minutes to complete and you are ready to go. The thermostat works as described and keeps accurate temps. I love that I can control it when I am away from home, you can monitor, change temp and even turn off or on. I did not get the one that has touch screen but this does everything from the app or just from saying Alexa set thermostat to 74, and the other associated settings are all voice controlled.
customer_reviews.author: King Family

customer_reviews.title: So...Yes!
customer_reviews.text: The tech support is first class and very patient. Dont lock the units if you have an questionable router or you're stuck untill you reset everything and start over. I love these thermostats, it will save me a lot of money being I dont have to depend on renters to turn of the HVAC off when they leave the property anymore and I can control them from anywhere. To complement these new gizmos I have a little 1080p wifi cam that I can also observe from anywhere so I can determine that renters have left the facility or arriving so I can manage the AC/Heat etc myself. I am so happy about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dreamer

product_meta.title: Emerson Sensi Wi-Fi Smart Thermostat for Smart Home, DIY, Works With Alexa, Energy Star Certified, ST55
product_meta.description: From across the room or across the country, your Sensi Wi-Fi thermostat makes it easy to remotely control and schedule your home comfort - Anytime. Anywhere. Designed to work with the wires you already have, Sensi thermostat does not require a common wire (c-wire) for most installations, so it is compatible with the HVAC equipment in many homes in U.S. Canada. A c-wire is required for heat-only, cool-only and heat pump (without aux) systems, and for use with Apple HomeKit. Check to make sure it will work for you at sensi.emerson.com/compatibility . The intuitive app walks you through each step of installation with custom configured instructions, removing all the frustration and guesswork from the installation process, so you can be up and running in no time, no experience required. Put your comfort on your terms using location-based temperature control with geofencing or creating custom heating and cooling schedules with the flexible 7-day scheduling option with the ENERGY STAR certified Sensi thermostat. Both energy saving features you save about 23% on your HVAC energy usage so you can save money without compromising your comfort. Plus, Sensi integrates directly with Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, Google Assistant and Wink home automation platforms. Connect to Amazon Alexa to control your home temperature with simple voice commands, or just ask Siri to set, raise or lower your home temperature when using Sensi with Apple HomeKit. Whats more, Sensi Wi-Fi Thermostat has been named the Best Value smart thermostat of 2018 by USA Todays Reviewed.com Energy savings calculated by comparing operation time for a nationwide sample of Sensi users with temperature adjustments averaging 4 degreeF vs. users with no adjustments. Savings vary based on equipment type/condition, insulation, climate temperature adjustment size/frequency. Based on survey results of 2120 respondents that purchased and installed a Sensi thermostat in 2018, approximately 70% reported installing in 30 minutes or less. Adding a common wire may impact installation time. Does not work with electric baseboard heat and some other systems. System requirements for mobile app: iOS - 10.0 or above Android - 4.2 or above (5.0 or greater to use the Geofencing feature).
feature_bullets: EDITORS CHOICE BEST VALUE SMART THERMOSTAT by USA Today’s Reviewed.com

SAVE ABOUT 23% ON HVAC ENERGY*: The ENERGY STAR certified Sensi thermostat helps you save on your HVAC energy costs, with features like geofencing, 7-day flexible scheduling, remote access and in-app system usage.

MOST INSTALL IN 30 MINUTES OR LESS**: Use the built-in level and step-by-step app instructions for a quick installation. Skip any extra work painting or patching the wall thanks to the standard thermostat size.

EXTENSIVE COMPATIBILITY***: Works with the HVAC equipment found in most homes - a c-wire is required for heat-only, cool-only and heat pump systems. Check system and router compatibility at sensi.emerson.com/compatibility
SMART HOME COMPATIBLE: Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple HomeKit (c-wire required), and Samsung SmartThings smart home platforms.
USAGE REPORTS: Monitor current day and historical heating, cooling and fan runtimes right in the app.
GET REBATES: Find utility rebates in your area through the rebate finder at sensi.emerson.com/rebates.
CONTROL FROM ANYWHERE: Remotely control your home comfort from your smartphone or tablet using the Sensi mobile app for Android and iOS devices.
SMART ALERTS: Sensi features smart alerts to help detect extreme temperature and humidity levels in your home.
CIRCULATING FAN: Air circulation may improve indoor air quality by helping to regulate temperature and prevent buildup of particles and mold.
